critique: The document aims to ensure the Selective Service Act's effectiveness during wartime. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is a sense of duty and commitment to national defense. The language emphasizes the 'high national importance' and 'fullest effectiveness' of the Act. There's also an element of fairness, discouraging favoritism or exemptions. The President hopes to inspire a sense of shared sacrifice and discourage attempts to evade service without legitimate cause. The tone is serious and authoritative, reflecting the gravity of the situation. The document also conveys a sense of urgency and the need for careful consideration in granting exemptions. The President wants to minimize disruptions to essential services while ensuring military readiness. The document also aims to reduce the number of discharges to the minimum number consistent with the maintenance of vital national interests during the emergency of war. The President hopes that all citizens will exercise the same conscientious and scrupulous caution to the end that there will appear to be no favored or exempted class among the citizens called by law to the national defense.
